overview: This measure seeks appropriations to satisfy twenty-one claims against the State, its officers, and its employees for fiscal year 2024-2025. Following an initial amendment that added nine claims, testimony from the Department of the Attorney General requests adding four more newly resolved claims. The bill now includes a declaration acknowledging that the appropriation will cause the state general fund expenditure ceiling to be exceeded.
appropriations: Testimony from the Department of the Attorney General requests a total appropriation of $6,498,867.07 (HB990_HD1) for fiscal year 2024-2025. This total includes a requested increase of $587,632.85 (HB990_HD1) to cover four new general fund claims. The requested appropriation is comprised of $5,158,867.07 (HB990_HD1) from general funds and $1,340,000.00 (HB990_HD1) from departmental funds.
agency_impact: The Department of the Attorney General will be responsible for expending the updated requested total of $5,158,867.07 (HB990_HD1) from the general fund. The Department of Transportation is impacted by claims totaling $1,250,000.00 (HB990_HD1) to be paid from departmental appropriations. The Judiciary is impacted by one claim for $90,000.00 (HB990_HD1) from its departmental funds.
policy_impact: The bill contains an explicit declaration regarding the state's general fund expenditure ceiling. Testimony from the Department of Budget and Finance specifies that the ceiling for fiscal year 2024-2025 has already been exceeded by $8,551,795 (HB990_TESTIMONY_JHA_02-12-25_) prior to this bill's appropriation. This measure is the procedural vehicle to authorize payments for these legally resolved claims.
revenue_sources: The updated requested appropriation draws $5,158,867.07 (HB990_HD1) from general revenues. Departmental funds provide the remaining $1,340,000.00 (HB990_HD1). This includes funds from the state highway fund for Department of Transportation claims and judiciary funds for its specific claim.
six_year_fiscal_implications: The bill's fiscal impact is a one-time appropriation for FY 2024-2025 with no recurring costs or establishment of new programs or positions. Testimony requests a total appropriation of $6,498,867.07 (HB990_HD1), which is comprised of $5,158,867.07 (HB990_HD1) from general funds and $1,340,000.00 (HB990_HD1) from departmental funds. As a non-recurring expense with a defined lapse date for unexpended funds, there are no fiscal implications for the subsequent five years.
updates_from_previous_fiscal_note: The total appropriation has been updated to reflect testimony from the Department of the Attorney General requesting the addition of four new claims. This request increases the general fund portion of the bill by $587,632.85 (HB990_HD1), bringing the total requested appropriation to $6,498,867.07 (HB990_HD1). New information from the Department of Budget and Finance specifies that the general fund expenditure ceiling for FY 2024-2025 was already exceeded by $8,551,795 (HB990_TESTIMONY_JHA_02-12-25_) before the appropriations in this bill.
